trans-unit.source: Common operations in the Machine Learning Recommendations API | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Common operations in the Machine Learning Recommendations API | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Azure ML Recommendation Sample Application
trans-unit.target: Azure ML Recommendation Sample Application

trans-unit.source: Common operations in the Machine Learning Recommendations API
trans-unit.target: Common operations in the Machine Learning Recommendations API

trans-unit.source: Purpose
trans-unit.target: Purpose

trans-unit.source: This document shows the usage of the Azure Machine Learning Recommendations API via a [sample application](http://1drv.ms/1xeO2F3).
trans-unit.target: This document shows the usage of the Azure Machine Learning Recommendations API via a [sample application](http://1drv.ms/1xeO2F3).

trans-unit.source: This application is not intended to include full functionality, nor does it use all the APIs.
trans-unit.target: This application is not intended to include full functionality, nor does it use all the APIs.

trans-unit.source: It demonstrates some common operations to perform when you first want to play with the Machine Learning recommendation service.
trans-unit.target: It demonstrates some common operations to perform when you first want to play with the Machine Learning recommendation service.

trans-unit.source: Introduction to Machine Learning recommendation service
trans-unit.target: Introduction to Machine Learning recommendation service

trans-unit.source: Recommendations via the Machine Learning recommendation service are enabled when you build a recommendation model based on the following data:
trans-unit.target: Recommendations via the Machine Learning recommendation service are enabled when you build a recommendation model based on the following data:

trans-unit.source: A repository of the items you want to recommend, also known as a catalog
trans-unit.target: A repository of the items you want to recommend, also known as a catalog

trans-unit.source: Data representing the usage of items per user or session (this can be acquired over time via data acquisition, not as part of the sample app)
trans-unit.target: Data representing the usage of items per user or session (this can be acquired over time via data acquisition, not as part of the sample app)

trans-unit.source: After a recommendation model is built, you can use it to predict items that a user might be interested in, according to a set of items (or a single item) the user selects.
trans-unit.target: After a recommendation model is built, you can use it to predict items that a user might be interested in, according to a set of items (or a single item) the user selects.

trans-unit.source: To enable the previous scenario, do the following in the Machine Learning recommendation service:
trans-unit.target: To enable the previous scenario, do the following in the Machine Learning recommendation service:

trans-unit.source: Create a model: This is a logical container that holds the data (catalog and usage) and the prediction model(s).
trans-unit.target: Create a model: This is a logical container that holds the data (catalog and usage) and the prediction model(s).

trans-unit.source: Each model container is identified via a unique ID, which is allocated when it is created.
trans-unit.target: Each model container is identified via a unique ID, which is allocated when it is created.

trans-unit.source: This ID is called the model ID, and it is used by most of the APIs.
trans-unit.target: This ID is called the model ID, and it is used by most of the APIs.

trans-unit.source: Upload to catalog: When a model container is created, you can associate to it a catalog.
trans-unit.target: Upload to catalog: When a model container is created, you can associate to it a catalog.

trans-unit.source: **Note**: Creating a model and uploading to a catalog are usually performed once for the model lifecycle.
trans-unit.target: **Note**: Creating a model and uploading to a catalog are usually performed once for the model lifecycle.

trans-unit.source: Upload usage: This adds usage data to the model container.
trans-unit.target: Upload usage: This adds usage data to the model container.

trans-unit.source: Build a recommendation model: After you have enough data, you can build the recommendation model.
trans-unit.target: Build a recommendation model: After you have enough data, you can build the recommendation model.

trans-unit.source: This operation uses the top Machine Learning algorithms to create a recommendation model.
trans-unit.target: This operation uses the top Machine Learning algorithms to create a recommendation model.

trans-unit.source: Each build is associated with a unique ID.
trans-unit.target: Each build is associated with a unique ID.

trans-unit.source: You need to keep a record of this ID because it is necessary for the functionality of some APIs.
trans-unit.target: You need to keep a record of this ID because it is necessary for the functionality of some APIs.

trans-unit.source: Monitor the building process: A recommendation model build is an asynchronous operation, and it can take from several minutes to several hours, depending on the amount of data (catalog and usage) and the build parameters.
trans-unit.target: Monitor the building process: A recommendation model build is an asynchronous operation, and it can take from several minutes to several hours, depending on the amount of data (catalog and usage) and the build parameters.

trans-unit.source: Therefore, you need to monitor the build.
trans-unit.target: Therefore, you need to monitor the build.

trans-unit.source: A recommendation model is created only if its associated build completes successfully.
trans-unit.target: A recommendation model is created only if its associated build completes successfully.

trans-unit.source: (Optional) Choose an active recommendation model build: This step is only necessary if you have more than one recommendation model built in your model container.
trans-unit.target: (Optional) Choose an active recommendation model build: This step is only necessary if you have more than one recommendation model built in your model container.

trans-unit.source: Any request to get recommendations without indicating the active recommendation model is redirected automatically by the system to the default active build.
trans-unit.target: Any request to get recommendations without indicating the active recommendation model is redirected automatically by the system to the default active build.

trans-unit.source: **Note**: An active recommendation model is production ready and it is built for production workload.
trans-unit.target: **Note**: An active recommendation model is production ready and it is built for production workload.

trans-unit.source: This differs from a non-active recommendation model, which stays in a test-like environment (sometimes called staging).
trans-unit.target: This differs from a non-active recommendation model, which stays in a test-like environment (sometimes called staging).

trans-unit.source: Get recommendations: After you have a recommendation model, you can trigger recommendations for a single item or a list of items that you select.
trans-unit.target: Get recommendations: After you have a recommendation model, you can trigger recommendations for a single item or a list of items that you select.

trans-unit.source: You will usually invoke Get Recommendation for a certain period of time.
trans-unit.target: You will usually invoke Get Recommendation for a certain period of time.

trans-unit.source: During that period of time, you can redirect usage data to the Machine Learning recommendation system, which adds this data to the specified model container.
trans-unit.target: During that period of time, you can redirect usage data to the Machine Learning recommendation system, which adds this data to the specified model container.

trans-unit.source: When you have enough usage data, you can build a new recommendation model that incorporates the additional usage data.
trans-unit.target: When you have enough usage data, you can build a new recommendation model that incorporates the additional usage data.

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: Visual Studio 2013
trans-unit.target: Visual Studio 2013

trans-unit.source: Internet access
trans-unit.target: Internet access

trans-unit.source: Azure Machine Learning sample app solution
trans-unit.target: Azure Machine Learning sample app solution

trans-unit.source: This solution contains the source code, sample usage, catalog file, and directives to download the packages that are required for compilation.
trans-unit.target: This solution contains the source code, sample usage, catalog file, and directives to download the packages that are required for compilation.

trans-unit.source: The APIs used
trans-unit.target: The APIs used

trans-unit.source: The application uses Machine Learning recommendation functionality via a subset of available APIs.
trans-unit.target: The application uses Machine Learning recommendation functionality via a subset of available APIs.

trans-unit.source: The following APIs are demonstrated in the application:
trans-unit.target: The following APIs are demonstrated in the application:

trans-unit.source: Create model: Create a logical container to hold data and recommendation models.
trans-unit.target: Create model: Create a logical container to hold data and recommendation models.

trans-unit.source: A model is identified by a name, and you cannot create more than one model with the same name.
trans-unit.target: A model is identified by a name, and you cannot create more than one model with the same name.

trans-unit.source: Upload catalog file: Use to upload catalog data.
trans-unit.target: Upload catalog file: Use to upload catalog data.

trans-unit.source: Upload usage file: Use to upload usage data.
trans-unit.target: Upload usage file: Use to upload usage data.

trans-unit.source: Trigger build: Use to create a recommendation model.
trans-unit.target: Trigger build: Use to create a recommendation model.

trans-unit.source: Monitor build execution: Use to monitor the status of a recommendation model build.
trans-unit.target: Monitor build execution: Use to monitor the status of a recommendation model build.

trans-unit.source: Choose a built model for recommendation: Use to indicate which recommendation model to use by default for a certain model container.
trans-unit.target: Choose a built model for recommendation: Use to indicate which recommendation model to use by default for a certain model container.

trans-unit.source: This step is necessary only if you have more than one recommendation model and you want to activate a non-active build as the active recommendation model.
trans-unit.target: This step is necessary only if you have more than one recommendation model and you want to activate a non-active build as the active recommendation model.

trans-unit.source: Get recommendation: Use to retrieve recommended items according to a given single item or a set of items.
trans-unit.target: Get recommendation: Use to retrieve recommended items according to a given single item or a set of items.

trans-unit.source: For a complete description of the APIs, please see the Microsoft Azure Marketplace documentation.
trans-unit.target: For a complete description of the APIs, please see the Microsoft Azure Marketplace documentation.

trans-unit.source: **Note**: A model can have several builds over time (not simultaneously).
trans-unit.target: **Note**: A model can have several builds over time (not simultaneously).

trans-unit.source: Each build is created with the same or an updated catalog and additional usage data.
trans-unit.target: Each build is created with the same or an updated catalog and additional usage data.

trans-unit.source: Common pitfalls
trans-unit.target: Common pitfalls

trans-unit.source: You need to provide your user name and your Microsoft Azure Marketplace primary account key to run the sample app.
trans-unit.target: You need to provide your user name and your Microsoft Azure Marketplace primary account key to run the sample app.

trans-unit.source: Running the sample app consecutively will fail.
trans-unit.target: Running the sample app consecutively will fail.

trans-unit.source: The application flow includes creating, uploading, building the monitor, and getting recommendations from a predefined model; therefore, it will fail on consecutive execution if you do not change the model name between invocations.
trans-unit.target: The application flow includes creating, uploading, building the monitor, and getting recommendations from a predefined model; therefore, it will fail on consecutive execution if you do not change the model name between invocations.

trans-unit.source: Recommendations might return without data.
trans-unit.target: Recommendations might return without data.

trans-unit.source: The sample app uses a very small catalog and usage file.
trans-unit.target: The sample app uses a very small catalog and usage file.

trans-unit.source: Therefore, some items from the catalog will have no recommended items.
trans-unit.target: Therefore, some items from the catalog will have no recommended items.

trans-unit.source: Disclaimer
trans-unit.target: Disclaimer

trans-unit.source: The sample app is not intended to be run in a production environment.
trans-unit.target: The sample app is not intended to be run in a production environment.

trans-unit.source: The data provided in the catalog is very small, and it will not provide a meaningful recommendation model.
trans-unit.target: The data provided in the catalog is very small, and it will not provide a meaningful recommendation model.

trans-unit.source: The data is provided as a demonstration.
trans-unit.target: The data is provided as a demonstration.

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
